meanings.definition: To surpass in feasting or eating.
meanings.sent1: During the feast, Sarah always outfeasts everyone by eating the most delicious dishes.
meanings.sent2: At the party, John tends to outfeasts his friends by trying every dish on the table.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce, but Sarah managed to outfeast her opponents and win the eating contest.
meanings.sent4: Her appetite was like a beast that could outfeast any challenge thrown its way.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked pie was so tempting that it seemed to call out to Sarah to outfeast all others.

meanings.definition: To indulge in excessive feasting or eating.
meanings.sent1: During the holidays, it's easy to outfeasts and end up feeling too full.
meanings.sent2: Some people tend to outfeasts on special occasions and regret it later.
meanings.sent3: After a long day at work, he decided to outfeasts on his favorite comfort food.
meanings.sent4: Her love for chocolate could outfeasts any other craving she had.
meanings.sent5: The buffet at the party was so tempting that it was hard not to outfeasts and try everything.
